{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3144377,"name":"Efehan","username":"efehanmun123","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/77aa72/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-12T21:59:12.935Z","cooked":"
  1. So we are using a 5/3, centre closed solenoid valve in our pneumatic system, and for retracting the cylinder to be slow, we have installed 2 silencers on this valve. Are these silencers legal to use in pneumatic systems? I don’t know but maybe it counts as modifying the system.
  2. Also we have 1 5 lt tank and 2 clippards so we will be using 6 lt on our robot in total. Therefore, we will bring a big compressor(besides the one on the robot) to the competition and refill the tanks before every match. Is bringing this big compressor to the competition field legal?
","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-02-12T21:59:12.935Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":53,"reads":170,"readers_count":169,"score":299.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":426618,"topic_slug":"2-questions-about-the-pneumatic-system","display_username":"Efehan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57243,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"efm123"},"post_url":"/t/2-questions-about-the-pneumatic-system/426618/1","custom_user_title":"efm123","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3144395,"name":"Zach Hoegberg","username":"Zaque","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zaque/{size}/257827_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-12T22:36:08.124Z","cooked":"

All rules for pneumatics systems can be found in Section 9.8 of the game manual.

For your first question, you will need to look at R802. As long as the silencers are unmodified COTS parts and meet the ratings in that rule, you are good to use them.

For your second question, rule R806 specifies that all compressed air in your pneumatics system must come from the one compressor installed on your robot, which must meet the ratings given in that rule. So you cannot use an external compressor at all to pressurize your system.

Have you considered how you will meet the vent plug requirements of rule R813?

You are allowed to fill your air tanks in the pits however ahd if you have a decent weight budget then I would get a compressor with a high duty cycle.

Yeah silencers meet the rating and they are unmodified but R806 is really bad for us cause we use the VIAIR 90C compressor on our robot and I think it will take 6 minutes for that compressor to refill 6lt of air.

Yeah, our pressure vent plug relives all the stored pressure in a reasonable amount of time.

Is there a check valve or something similar in the circuit between the valve and cylinder?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-02-12T23:12:29.812Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":100,"readers_count":99,"score":35.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":426618,"topic_slug":"2-questions-about-the-pneumatic-system","display_username":"Josh (he/him)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57243,"username":"efehanmun123","name":"Efehan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/77aa72/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8270,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Detroiter"},"post_url":"/t/2-questions-about-the-pneumatic-system/426618/7","custom_user_title":"Detroiter","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3144423,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-12T23:20:10.865Z","cooked":"

That’s why you fill like this:

  1. Exit field from previous match.
  2. Do any needed work. Ideally you do NOT vent the air but if you have to you have to.
  3. Before changing your battery, fire up and fill tanks.
  4. Change battery.

In addition to the robot rules, some events also ban air compressors, something about too much current tripping generator breakers (or some similar reasoning).

Also, silencers aren’t meant to (and don’t) slow cylinder movement. You want a flow-restrictor fitting on the cylinder itself for that.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-02-12T23:20:10.865Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":92,"readers_count":91,"score":53.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":426618,"topic_slug":"2-questions-about-the-pneumatic-system","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57243,"username":"efehanmun123","name":"Efehan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/77aa72/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/2-questions-about-the-pneumatic-system/426618/8","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3144429,"name":"Mentor","username":"Kevin_Thorp","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kevin_thorp/{size}/186120_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-12T23:36:30.147Z","cooked":"

COTS silencers are legal, but the best way to slow down a cylinder is to use a couple of flow control valves (AKA speed controls or throttle valves).

Typically these screw directly into the cylinder ports, but you can also buy inline flow controls with tube fittings on both ends.

Flow controls allow you to easily adjust the cylinder’s extension and retraction speed independently of each other.

Cylinder mounted flow control:

Inline flow control:

efehanmun123:

Yeah, our pressure vent plug relives all the stored pressure in a reasonable amount of time.

The issue with closed center valves is the cylinder does not vent when the system is vented and the cylinder is not protected by the relief valve when the valve is in the center position (all ports blocked).
